pageContext.claim: “This should have been taken care of 30 years ago, 20 years ago, 10 years ago. It should have been taken care of. I've seen all the speeches made by all the Presidents and a lot people that worked under the Presidents. And you say, What happened? Nothing happened. They were going to build this wall in 2003, in 2006. They were going to build it 20 years ago. They were going to build it forever. And little sections got built.”
pageContext.analysis: Both George W. Bush and Barack Obama tried hard to achieve a solution that improved border security and provided a possible path to citizenship for 11 million undocumented immigrants, in both cases attracting significant bipartisan support. But the efforts failed because of firm opposition from many right-leaning lawmakers. Obama's bill passed the Senate by a 68-32 vote in 2013 but the Republican-controlled House refused to bring it up for a vote. Neither man pressed for a wall. Bush won funds for fencing in 2006, which Trump dismissed as a "nothing wall."
